p: A significant difference is observed between simulations (Fig. 4, left column). Those evolutions based on the hydrologic conditions (i.e., R/P) set for 2005–2015 and 2050 show a continuous decline towards the equilibrium value that is reached earlier in those aquifers with small turnover times. This is because both R and P values are assumed constant, and only the magnitude of P varies according to climatic predictions affecting Q and, consequently, the final equilibrium concentration. Complementarily, a linearly varying change of hydrologic conditions for the next 50 years implies a faster achievement of the nitrate concentration equilibrium value.
